Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Gostamos de resolver problemas e não passamos um dia sem procurar soluções inovadoras. A Ytech é uma start-up tecnológica focada nos setores de IT e Telecomunicações que atua em duas principais áreas: desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e projetos internacionais remotos.


🚀 Ready to join us, Data Scientist?


Tens as skills?

  • Experiência mínima de 5 anos;
  • Experiência em linguagens Python, R, SQL, processos ETL e tecnologias de Big Data;
  • Proficiência em Machine Learning;
  • Experiência em Power BI e SSRS;
  • Proficiência em extração de dados via API's;


O que nos torna diferentes

• A nossa visão consiste em inovar e reinventar através de serviços tecnológicos, promovendo o sucesso dos nossos parceiros.

• A nossa missão é conectar clientes a profissionais altamente especializados e impulsionar negócios.

• A nossa cultura é centrada nas pessoas e no seu bem-estar, o que nos permite atrair e reter o melhor de talento.


Junta-te à equipa Ytech! Envia o teu CV para abaiao@ytech.io

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.




A typical day

Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.




What you need to succeed

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…




💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
🍏 Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)
Show more
HTML:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!


Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?


What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.


A typical day

  • Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
  • Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
  • Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
  • Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
  • Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
  • Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
  • Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
  • Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
  • Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
  • Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.


What you need to succeed

  • BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
  • Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
  • Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
  • Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
  • Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
  • Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
  • Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
  • Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
  • Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
  • Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
  • Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.


About the recruitment process

  • Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
  • Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
  • If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
  • If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.


Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…


  • 💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
  • ⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
  • 🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
  • 📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
  • 🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
  • 🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
  • 🍏 Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We're partnered with a VC-backed climate tech startup whose mission is to drive climate action through data. Their intelligent platform empowers organisations to tackle climate issues by monitoring their carbon footprint. It's currently being used by global sustainability leaders!




On the hunt for TWO talented Machine Learning Engineers with experience in Search, Recommendation Engines, and Text Classification to join our dynamic team. You'll collaborate with developers, scientists, and experts to improve AI features that are at the core of what we do. If you're someone who loves taking ownership of projects and working in a team, this could be a great fit for you!




What you’ll do:

Build, develop, and maintain ML models, NLP, and Information Retrieval systems that power carbon intelligence globally.
Deliver key data and insights through platforms that support major enterprises in their climate action efforts.
Experiment and optimize models (like transformers, classifiers, LLMs) to improve our product’s search and recommendation engine.
Keep our data pipelines in check, ensuring everything’s ready for modeling.
Deploy and manage models using AWS SageMaker, Flask, and Pydantic.




What you’ll need:

Extensive experience in Machine Learning, specifically with Search, Classification, and Information Retrieval.
Python experience, specifically working with data pipelines and REST APIs.
A self-starter who enjoys problem-solving and working independently.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with remote teams.




What's in it for you?:

Genuinely making a positive impact on the planet
Salary €100K-120K
Benefits, including employee stock options
As a remote-first company, their team collaborates from locations across Europe.




If this is of interest to you, please apply now!

Title: Data Scientist – AI/ML Development
Company: Toyota Financial Services Europe and Africa
Description:
YOUR ROLE:

As a Data Scientist – AI/ML Development (Entry to Mid-Level), you will drive the use of machine learning to unlock business insights. Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders, you will build and train AI models, interpret outcomes, and communicate actionable insights in an accessible way. This role is ideal for candidates with a solid foundation in data science who are eager to grow their technical expertise and create real business impact in a collaborative environment.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Data Preparation & Model Development:

Work with diverse data sources, ensuring data is cleaned, prepared, and fit for analysis.
Develop and fine-tune models across predictive analytics, supervised and unsupervised learning, and generative AI applications.

Cross-Team Collaboration:

Partner with BI and IT teams to optimize data pipelines and ensure seamless data access.
Act as a bridge between technical teams and business stakeholders, translating technical outputs into strategic business insights.

Model Interpretation & Business Impact:

Analyse model performance, interpret outcomes, and present findings in an accessible manner to non-technical audiences.
Translate model results into actionable recommendations that support data-driven business decisions.

Process Optimization:

Leverage existing tools, frameworks, and cloud solutions to build efficient, scalable models.
Identify opportunities for improving data workflows, model effectiveness, and overall ML operations.




YOUR EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, IT, or a related field.
2+ years of hands-on experience with data preparation, statistical analysis, and machine learning model development.
Strong programming skills in Python and/or R, including experience with libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Familiarity with building predictive models for asset valuation, using time series and distributional analysis techniques.
Hands-on experience building predictive models using real-world, messy datasets.
Experience working with cloud-based ML services (e.g., AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, GCP Vertex AI).
Familiarity with MLOps concepts such as model versioning, monitoring, and automated retraining pipelines.
Knowledge of experiment tracking tools like MLflow, or version control for model development.
Bonus: Experience in AI/ML lab setups, platform development, or scaling machine learning projects across multiple teams.




YOUR PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:

A curious mindset with a passion for understanding data and solving problems.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate technical insights into business terms.
Hands-on mentality, solution orientation and a proactive work style.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
A team player who thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Eager to learn and grow in the field of data science.




WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US:

A multicultural, inspiring working environment
Flat hierarchies and an open communication culture
Flexible working hours and a modern office in the heart of Düsseldorf
Continuous opportunities for professional and personal development
Encouragement to independently develop and implement new ideas and concepts

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

The very rapid development of e-commerce today gives access to thousands of information. These data are difficult to exploit by companies, which then have difficulty choosing the right levers of action and measuring their impact.

This is where NIQ for Digital Commerce comes in! Every day, we collect more than 60 billion pieces of information, process them and use them in innovative monitoring and action tools for professionals in the sector. Our goal: to give our customers and consumers real-time visibility into the market. Today : NIQ for Digital Commerce is a leading start-up in the ‘Retail Analytics’ sector. In full growth, particularly internationally, we are looking for new collaborators to join our fabulous team! A young but experienced, dynamic and complementary team: a resolutely start-up spirit! Real job and career opportunities A friendly atmosphere and a climate of trust that promotes autonomy and challenge!

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our growing Machine Learning team. Your work will entail working on one or more projects at a time with tasks such as:


Developing ML tools (web services, APIs, etc)
Preparing data for ML models
Researching the latest technologies used in ML (time-series, NLP, Image recognition, ...)
Developing and improving predictive model


Qualifications


Proficiency with Python, knowledge of programming languages such as C++ and Golang is a plus
Experience with ML technologies such as Pytorch, Tensorflow, Keras
Experience with time-series analysis is a plus
Experience in data engineering is a plus
Work environment (Linux, Jupyter, Python, Git, Docker, SQL, NoSQL, …)
Significant experience with Pandas, SQL technologies and writing Dockerfiles
Professional level of French and English


Additional Information


Our office is located in Paris XI district
Our teams enjoy a Hybrid work model (2/ week At the office)


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Scientist Senior - MLOps & Transformation (F/H)
Description:
Le groupe RENAULT s'engage résolument dans une nouvelle ère, propulsée par sa stratégie RENAULution, qui place la Data et l'Intelligence Artificielle au cœur de sa transformation.




Renault Digital, acteur clé de cette révolution depuis 2017, contribue activement à relever les défis de la mobilité de demain et à façonner l'industrie 4.0.




Rejoignez notre Centre d'Excellence IA (AI CoE), une équipe agile de 30 Data Scientists et Data Analysts, et participez à la conception, au développement et au déploiement à grande échelle de solutions Data et IA innovantes qui impacteront l'ensemble de nos activités.




Votre mission :

En tant que Data Scientist Senior, vous serez un acteur clé de la transformation des processus métier de Renault grâce à la puissance de la Data et de l'IA. Votre rôle consistera à :




Comprendre les enjeux métiers : Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes métier pour identifier les défis, les opportunités et les besoins en matière de Data et d'IA.
Concevoir et développer des solutions : Traduire les besoins métiers en problèmes de Data Science et concevoir des solutions innovantes et performantes, allant de la modélisation prédictive à l'optimisation des processus.
Déployer et industrialiser les modèles : Participer activement au déploiement des modèles en production en utilisant les enablers IA implémenté au sein du CoE, en mettant en œuvre les bonnes pratiques MLOps (automatisation, monitoring, gestion des versions...) pour garantir leur fiabilité, leur performance et leur scalabilité.
Contribuer à la création d’enablers techniques : Dans le cadre de nos activités de déploiement, collaborer à la création des outils techniques pour accélérer les processus de mise en production des solutions IA.
Communiquer et vulgariser : Présenter les résultats des analyses et des modèles de manière claire et concise aux équipes métier, en adaptant le discours au public cible et en mettant en évidence la valeur ajoutée des solutions.
Innover et partager les best practices : Se tenir informé des dernières avancées en Data Science / IA et en software engineering afin de contribuer à l'amélioration continue des pratiques et des outils au sein de l'équipe et du groupe Renault en général.
Être un ambassadeur de la Data : Promouvoir la culture Data et l'adoption de l'IA au sein de l'entreprise.




Profil recherché :

Diplôme d'ingénieur ou Master en Data Science, Statistiques, Mathématiques, Informatique ou domaine connexe.
Minimum 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Scientist, avec une expérience significative dans la conception, le développement et le déploiement de solutions Data et IA en environnement industriel ou sur le cloud.
Solide connaissance des algorithmes de Machine Learning et des techniques statistiques.
Maîtrise de Python et des principales librairies de Data Science (Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch...).
Bonne connaissance des outils et des pratiques MLOps (CI/CD, conteneurs, Git, Kubernetes, Airflow...).
Familiarité avec les plateformes Cloud (GCP de préférence).
Excellentes compétences en communication et en vulgarisation.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des interlocuteurs de différents horizons.
Forte orientation business et capacité à comprendre les enjeux de l'entreprise.
Maîtrise de l'anglais (écrit et oral).




Les plus qui feront la différence :

Profil ayant travaillé sur de multiples sujets dans des environnements variés.
Expérience dans le secteur automobile ou dans un environnement industriel similaire.
Connaissance des enjeux de la mobilité de demain.
Certifications GCP et Dataiku.
Participation à des conférences ou des événements Data Science.




Informations complémentaires :

Poste basé à Boulogne-Billancourt (France) en CDI (temps plein)
Accord télétravail




Vous êtes prêt(e)s à relever avec nous les défis de la data, n’hésitez pas à postuler !!

Show more

  • Solide connaissance des algorithmes de Machine Learning et des techniques statistiques.
  • Maîtrise de Python et des principales librairies de Data Science (Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch...).
  • Bonne connaissance des outils et des pratiques MLOps (CI/CD, conteneurs, Git, Kubernetes, Airflow...).
  • Familiarité avec les plateformes Cloud (GCP de préférence).
  • Excellentes compétences en communication et en vulgarisation.
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des interlocuteurs de différents horizons.
  • Forte orientation business et capacité à comprendre les enjeux de l'entreprise.
  • Maîtrise de l'anglais (écrit et oral).


Les plus qui feront la différence :

  • Profil ayant travaillé sur de multiples sujets dans des environnements variés.
  • Expérience dans le secteur automobile ou dans un environnement industriel similaire.
  • Connaissance des enjeux de la mobilité de demain.
  • Certifications GCP et Dataiku.
  • Participation à des conférences ou des événements Data Science.


Informations complémentaires :

  • Poste basé à Boulogne-Billancourt (France) en CDI (temps plein)
  • Accord télétravail


Vous êtes prêt(e)s à relever avec nous les défis de la data, n’hésitez pas à postuler !!

Title: Data Scientist (Statistical Analyst)
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.




Job Description:




The purpose of this position is to support our cross media measurement in Poland, Ukraine, Adriatic and support the international TAM business across the region. Responsibilities range from BAU reporting, analysis, optimizing the current codebase, lightweight automation, to new product and methodology implementations.




Cooperating with the stakeholders and other Data Science team in the organization. Ensuring analytic and technical support to the clients, supporting client engagement under the Data Science topics.

 

Supporting local Operation teams at data quality control, data validation and process improvement. Contribution to internal DSCI topic related projects. Contribution to audit procedures. Contribution to tender procedures to keep and grow the business footprint of Nielsen.




Responsibilities :
Set up tailor made large scale survey design,  implement and improve sampling and weighting methodologies, establish and improve questionnaire design
Create universe estimation from survey database and / or third party data
Design, implement and  improve methodologies, including multivariable statistical models are applied for :
Data validation and quality control to ensure data quality standards are achieved
Complex trend analyses of linear and nonlinear viewing.
Viewing behavior analysis to detect any abnormality on the trends
Checking extreme viewers to verify the consistency of the behavioral trend
Panel behavior analysis to detect any abnormality on the trends
Recommending design and analyzing the outcome of pilot projects for operational process improvement
Ensure methodologies are fit for purpose and working as intended; troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve when they are not
Coding for
Deploy and maintain scalable, reusable/modular data procedures, and models for analytical, or reporting purposes. 
Automatize regular analyses and data procedures
Develop, implement and maintain good programming standards and practices across our data science and analytics codebases
Communicate research findings
Present to varying audiences, internal and external clients
Data visualization, including building dashboards
Create methodological, product and process documentation
Work with cross-functional teams to productionize, validate, analyze and/or optimize methodologies





Skills :
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative research field, such as computer science, data science, statistics, mathematics, biological/physical sciences, economics, social science.
Outstanding statistical and analytical skills
2+ years research and code development experience in a business setting
Strong proficiency with Python and R / SPSS
Java, Spark, SQL, Unix, git, and AWS (S3 and EC2) + Machine learning fundamentals are advantage
Collaborative code development experience, including version control, unit/integration testing, code review and sharing is advantage
Language skills: Polish and English full professional proficiency. Ukrainian would be an advantage
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent debugging skills
Cooperative and supportive attitude. Curiosity and skepticism. Detailed and precise workload management
Transparency, honesty, including problem communication











Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




😍 Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist (NLP/Gen AI/CNN Specialist) – Remote/ Hybrid




Are you a Data Scientist with deep expertise in NLP, Generative AI, and CNNs? Do you thrive on building models from scratch and solving complex, real-world problems?




The Role

My client looking for innovative Senior Data Scientists to join their team and drive cutting-edge AI/ML solutions. You’ll work on training, fine-tuning, and deploying models—from foundational architectures to production-ready systems—with a focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP), Generative AI, and Computer Vision (CNN).




Key Responsibilities:

Develop, train, and optimize NLP models (LLMs, transformers, embeddings) and Generative AI solutions
Design and implement CNN-based computer vision models for complex datasets
Build end-to-end ML pipelines—from data preprocessing to model deployment
Apply deep learning techniques to solve business challenges at scale
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to productionize models
Stay ahead of emerging AI trends (diffusion models, RLHF, multimodal AI)




Required Skills:

Strong foundation in ML/DL: Experience training models from scratch (PyTorch/TensorFlow)
NLP Expertise: Hands-on with LLMs, transformers, text generation, embeddings, RAG
Generative AI: Fine-tuning, prompt engineering, or developing diffusion/VAE/GAN models
Programming: Python (PySpark, Scikit-learn), SQL, cloud platforms (Azure, Databricks, Snowflake)
Data Engineering: Big data processing, ETL pipelines, and optimization
Problem-solving: Ability to translate business needs into ML solutions




Preferred Qualifications:

MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field
Experience with healthcare, temporal data, or high-stakes ML applications
Published research or open-source contributions in AI/ML
Familiarity with MLOps, model deployment (Docker, Kubernetes), and scalable AI systems

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About us

Over the past few months, and with a founding team consisting of Julien, second time founder with a PhD in materials science, and Katie, former experienced operator within the climate tech space, we have raised our first round of funding from leading investors, secured several letters of intent and demonstrated that we have a way of boosting the world's production of recycled copper.

We have developed a new wire-forming technology that produces high-conductivity copper wire without the need for 99.95% pure copper raw materials. No smelting. No refining. Just a smarter process.




By eliminating these costly and highly polluting steps, we are considerably reducing the overall cost of copper wire production, while making use of millions of tonnes of copper scrap currently unsuitable for electrical use. Our technology paves the way for fully circular and cost-effective copper wire production, making it an essential part of the global energy transition.

We’re now building our core team, and it’s the perfect time to jump on board.




About the role

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with a strong background in deep learning for predictive process control, to help us model and optimize our novel mechanical and thermal wire forming process.




You’ll take the lead on developing a model-based controller capable of anticipating system behavior and driving performance improvements in real-time. Your work will sit at the intersection of physical process modeling, data-driven algorithms, and real-world industrial systems.




Contract: CDI (permanent)
Location: Nanterre (hybrid)
Language: English fluency required. French is a plus but not required.




Your responsibilities

Develop and deploy predictive control algorithms to optimize mechanical and thermal processes for wire forming
Build hybrid models using deep learning and physics-based insights, incorporating process data and literature-based proxies
Design and implement efficient data collection pipelines from characterization methods to support model training and validation, to gather an optimized dataset
Simulate process dynamics, stress-test control logic, and run live tests on physical prototypes
Ensure the system is robust to uncertainties and ready for industrial scale-up




Ideal background

Engineering degree, MSc or PhD in Machine Learning, Control Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Material Science or related field
Strong hands on experience in model-based controlling and reinforcement learning for process control/material characterization
Proven track record applying deep learning to real-world physical systems
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, C++)
Familiarity with simulation tools (e.g., Abaqus, Ansys, Simulink, Modelica, or custom simulation environments)
Bonus: Experience working with manufacturing systems or industrial process control
Bonus: Demonstrated initiative in building and experimenting, whether through side projects, small-scale physical prototypes, or hands-on tinkering in a garage or lab




What we offer

We’re building a world-class industrial deep tech company, and we’re doing it from the ground up. You’ll be one of the earliest team members, shaping not only the tech, but the culture, direction, and impact of our start-up.




CDI contract
Competitive compensation + BSPCE package
50% health insurance coverage
Hybrid work model (office in Nanterre)




We believe deep tech needs deep diversity. We’re committed to building an inclusive, impact-driven team, and if you’re excited by our mission but don’t tick every box, we’d still love to hear from you. We value versatility and the ability to learn, which is absolutely essential at this stage of our business.




Let’s build the future of circular copper, together.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the challenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:




· DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




· DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




· DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.







Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for a Data Scientist to join us:




Required Competencies:Experience in project and team management
MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field (MSc/PhD in Data Science is a plus)
+2 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role
Proven knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and text dataset curation
Hands-on experience in coding for real-world data analytics applications
Experience in NLP tasks, such as Text Classification, NER, and Information Retrieval
Experience working with LLMs, OpenAI API (or equivalent), and RAG
Proficiency in Python and ML/DL packages (PyTorch, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas)
Solid mathematical foundations and experience in statistical consultancy
Strong business sense with the ability to quickly understand use cases
Familiarity with data engineering, modeling, and business analysis
Good communication skills
Fluency in English and Portuguese




Preferential Competencies:

-Experience with Cafe

-Programming languages like Java, R and C++

-Knowledge of cloud tools such as Azure, AWS, Google Cloud

-Experience with MLOPs practices

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Global Consulting Partner - Madrid




Tech stack: Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist




Our client, one of the most known consultancy companies in the world is looking to expand their Data & Analytics team, bringing some professionals that want to work with the best clients in th emarket.




Our client is looking for talented, enthusiastic and passionate Data Scientists (Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist) to bring their services to the market and help enhance this already successful company!




Successful Data Scientists candidates should be able to demonstrate strong knowledge of: Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes




Training will be provided in any of the technologies you lack, allowing you to turn your technological weaknesses into your greatest strengths!




All Data Scientists positions come with the following benefits:




25 days holiday (plus Public Holidays)
REAL flexibility on how and when you work
Allowance for trainings/certifications/conferences
Insurance
Private medical




Location: Madrid, Spain / Hybrid Working




Salary: 49k for Seniors and above 50k for managers (with 20% bonus)




InterEx Group are Experts in Data, ERP and CRM, we are committed to supporting your career progression!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Randstad is recruiting a Data Scientist, for direct integration, in a start-up company that develops a no-code Artificial Intelligence platform that simplifies the integration of AI for companies.

They have offices in Braga and Lisbon. The work is hybrid in one of these locations 1 day / week or month.

Responsibilities

  • Development and implementation of advanced analytical models and machine learning algorithms.
  • Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
  • Undertaking the pre-processing of structured and unstructured data
  • Selecting features, building, and optimizing models using machine learning techniques
  • Correlating disparate data
  • Ability to build/amend Python APIs and machine-learning algorithms to support and deliver solutions


Qualifications


  • 2 years minimum of work experience;
  • Master’s degree in a science field (informatics engineering, computer science, mathematics, biomedical engineering, physics engineering, etc.);
  • Good understanding of machine learning algorithms and concepts such as convolutional neural networks, recurrent neural networks, transformer architectures, decision trees, boosting;
  • Good programming knowledge in Python and its math & machine learning packages such as numpy, scikit-learn, pandas/dask, tensorflow/keras, pytorch, etcExperience in developing and deploying machine learning models in a real production environment;
  • Experience with Large Language Models and Generative AI is valued;
  • Experience with NoSQL, RabbitMQ and Docker is also valued;
  • Git versioning control;
  • Proficient English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Medical R&D Sector – Confidential Client)




About the role




On behalf of one of our clients — a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)— we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Medior Machine Learning Engineer




This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.




Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.




Profile Sought

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
Excellent command of Python.
Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
Knowledge of GPU computing environments.




Offer

Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior AI/ML Engineer – LLM & Production Systems




Location: Berlin (Hybrid) | Type: Full-time




Join us at the cutting edge of Conversational Ai. We're building enterprise-scale AI systems that power real-time, multilingual conversations between brands and customers. If you're passionate about LLMs, production-grade ML systems, and creating tangible product impact—this is the role for you.




What You’ll Do

Design and scale AI systems that are production-ready, resilient, and built for enterprise use
Build and optimise real-time LLM inference pipelines to support high-volume, low-latency environments
Own full-stack ML responsibilities, from training to deployment, monitoring, and optimisation
Develop intelligent search systems using vector databases and embedding pipelines
Drive multilingual AI capabilities for a global customer base
Collaborate across teams to bring cutting-edge AI capabilities into live product experiences
Leverage modern infrastructure, from PyTorch and Weaviate to Gemini and cloud-native ML stacks




What You Bring

An advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or a related field
3–5 years of hands-on experience delivering ML/AI systems into production
Deep knowledge of LLMs, RAG, and model evaluation methodologies
Expertise in Python, along with ML frameworks like PyTorch or PyTorch Lightning
Experience with cloud-based ML tooling (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Strong debugging skills—comfortable diagnosing model drift, performance issues, and data anomalies
Familiarity with MLOps/LLMOps best practices, including CI/CD, observability, and pipeline automation
A builder’s mindset—curious, driven, and motivated by shipping AI that solves real problems




Why You’ll Love It Her

Work on real-world AI challenges that impact thousands of global users
Use cutting-edge tools like Weaviate, Gemini, and PyTorch
Shape the direction of our AI roadmap with real ownership and influence
Be part of a culture that values innovation, collaboration, and celebrating wins—big and small
Enjoy competitive compensation, virtual stock options (VSOP), and a vibrant office in central Berlin
Thrive in a startup environment with flexibility, autonomy, and purpose

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
We are growing our Data Science team to help Tendam solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Data Scientist for a unique opportunity of impacting the way the world experiences fashion.

What you will do

Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Design, implement and maintain ETL processes to ensure data is available, reliable and ready for analysis and reporting.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Present information using data visualization techniques (Quicksight)

What we are looking for

Scientific background with computational and analytical skills
Strong problem-solving skills
Programming skills with Python and SQL
Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)
Experience with data visualization tools and packages
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
>2 year of industry experience

Extra qualifications

Experience working with huge amounts of data
Experience with cloud-based web services (e.g., AWS)
Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git).

Why Tendam

One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members
Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc.
Working with cutting edge technologies and building machine learning models to solve real world problems: have a real impact in the business!
Ability to immediately test the model results in real pilots: quick time to market!
Exposure to agile methodologies
Collaborating with a team of Data Scientists in an environment focused on learning, innovation, and professional development.
Working in a challenging and dynamic industry

Show more
HTML:
We are growing our Data Science team to help Tendam solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Data Scientist for a unique opportunity of impacting the way the world experiences fashion.

What you will do

  1. Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations
  2. Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
  3. Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
  4. Design, implement and maintain ETL processes to ensure data is available, reliable and ready for analysis and reporting.
  5. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
  6. Present information using data visualization techniques (Quicksight)

What we are looking for

  1. Scientific background with computational and analytical skills
  2. Strong problem-solving skills
  3. Programming skills with Python and SQL
  4. Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)
  5. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)
  6. Experience with data visualization tools and packages
  7. A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
  8. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  9. >2 year of industry experience

Extra qualifications

  1. Experience working with huge amounts of data
  2. Experience with cloud-based web services (e.g., AWS)
  3. Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git).

Why Tendam

  1. One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members
  2. Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc.
  3. Working with cutting edge technologies and building machine learning models to solve real world problems: have a real impact in the business!
  4. Ability to immediately test the model results in real pilots: quick time to market!
  5. Exposure to agile methodologies
  6. Collaborating with a team of Data Scientists in an environment focused on learning, innovation, and professional development.
  7. Working in a challenging and dynamic industry

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist
Description:
Deine Aufgaben


Als Teil unseres AI & Data Science Teams entwickelst du datengetriebene Lösungen für Herausforderungen unserer Kunden im Bereich Sales und Marketing.
Mit deinem Fachwissen und Business-Verständnis unterstützt du bei der Übersetzung von Kundenanforderungen in konkrete Konzepte.
Du bist insbesondere an der operativen Umsetzung beteiligt und durchläufst den gesamten Prozess von der Datenaufbereitung bis zur Analyse und Ergebnispräsentation.
Unser AI & Data Science Team übernimmt eine Vielzahl von Aufgaben – gemeinsam finden wir den optimalen Mix für Dich:
Untersuchen und Aufbereiten von Daten für Prozesse und Analysen
Deskriptive Analysen und Visualisierungen
Gewinnung von Insights durch Experimente und statistische Datenanalysen
Aufbau von supervised und unsupervised Machine Learning Modellen
Einsatz von AI und NLP zur Entwicklung innovativer Lösungsansätze
Konzeption, Entwicklung und Implementierung von Data Science Services

Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Data Science, Informatik, VWL oder einem anderen quantitativ-analytischen Fach.
Erfahrung mit Analysemethoden aus Statistik, Ökonometrie, Machine Learning, NLP oder Deep Learning.
Gute Coding-Fähigkeiten in Python, insbesondere zur Datenaufbereitung, mit mindestens einem Jahr praktischer Erfahrung.
Kenntnisse in SQL, R, Git, Crawling oder allgemeine Programmiererfahrung sind ein Plus.
Du brennst für Data Science und hast eine hohe Affinität zu Zahlen und Daten, möchtest aber durch deine Analysen auch aktiv den Business-Erfolg beeinflussen.
Du hast einen hohen Qualitätsanspruch an deine Arbeit und stellst dies durch effektive Teststrategien sicher.
Du bist eine Lösungsfinderin / ein Lösungsfinder für die Herausforderungen unserer Kund:innen mit einem ausgeprägten Maß an Proaktivität, Selbstständigkeit und Organisationsfähigkeit.
Teamplay ist für dich selbstverständlich und du überzeugst unsere Kund:innen bei Bedarf auch vor Ort.
Deutsch und Englisch mindestens auf C1-Niveau.


Dein Extra


Großartiger Teamspirit und spannende Aufgaben in einem innovativen Zukunftsmarkt mit einer Kultur der Verantwortung, Offenheit und Zusammenarbeit.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Home-Office-Tage, „Work from Anywhere“ in Europa, kostenloses Massage- und Physioangebot, Activity-Raum mit Kicker, regelmäßige Team-Events.
Leckerer Kaffee aus einer professionellen Siebträgermaschine und andere Getränke
Aktuelle Hard- und Software sowie Arbeit mit vielfältigen Daten aus verschiedenen Phasen des Data Lifecycles.
Raum zur Mitgestaltung: Deine Ideen und Erfahrungen fließen direkt in die Weiterentwicklung unseres Teams ein.
Zentrale Lage und moderne Büros direkt am Gänsemarkt, verkehrsgünstig zu erreichen.
Intensive Begleitung im Rahmen des DATALOGUE Entwicklungsprogramms gepaart mit einer offenen Feedbackkultur über alle Ebenen, durch die du gezielt in deiner persönlichen Entwicklung unterstützt wirst.
Kooperationen mit Urban Sports Club, Fitness First, Jobrad sowie weiteren Partnern – für deine Gesundheit und dein Wohlbefinden.


Über uns

Data Monetization by Customer Relevance: Dafür steht DATALOGUE. Daten bilden bei uns den Grundstein für alle unsere Projekte – sie sind unsere Leidenschaft und unser täglicher Antrieb. Wir bei DATALOGUE unterstützen unsere Kunden, relevante Insights aus Daten zu generieren und nutzen Data Intelligence, um die Customer Experience im gesamten Kundenlebenszyklus zu optimieren – für bessere Leadgewinnung, optimale Kundenbindung, effizienteres Marketing und mehr Ertrag für unsere Kunden. An unseren nationalen und internationalen Standorten in Hamburg, Zürich und Amsterdam betreut ein Expertenteam etablierte Marken aus den Bereichen Finanz- und Versicherungswirtschaft, Touristik, Bildung, Entertainment und Telekommunikation sowie aus der Energie- und der Konsumgüterbranche – darunter die Freenet Group, die Hamburger Sparkasse, Metro, A-ROSA oder der Schweizer Augenoptik-Experte Visilab.

Mit der Relevance Group schaffen wir die Basis für mehr Business Impact und nachhaltiger Customer Relevance: Werde jetzt ein Teil unserer spannenden Reise!

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Who We Are

aquaManager is a global leader in aquaculture management software, driving innovation in one of the world's fastest-growing food production sectors. Our mission is to empower aquaculture businesses to meet the rising food demands of a rapidly growing population while fostering sustainability. With a dedicated, experienced team and immense growth potential, we aim to make a transformative impact on the industry and the planet.

The Role

We are seeking a talented Senior AI/ML Engineer & Team Leader who is passionate about pushing the boundaries of image processing and data analysis. This role offers an incredible opportunity to lead a team of experts, contribute to strategic R&D efforts, and drive groundbreaking projects that harness the power of artificial intelligence to solve complex challenges in aquaculture.

Specific responsibilities include:


Lead the development and deployment of innovative AI/ML algorithms and models for image processing and data analysis.
Guide and mentor a growing team of engineers, fostering technical excellence and collaboration.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define research directions and translate them into scalable, real-world solutions.
Design, optimize, and validate machine learning methodologies for extracting insights from complex, large-scale visual datasets.
Oversee field implementation of developed solutions and maintain direct engagement with customers and real users.
Continuously explore and integrate emerging technologies to strengthen our AI-driven capabilities.
Ensure that our AI/ML solutions are ethical, responsible, and aligned with the company's mission and industry standards.



Requirements


Proven experience in leading AI/ML projects or teams, ideally with a focus on computer vision or applied machine learning.
Passion for solving actual, real-world problems, creativity, exceptional problem-solving skills, and a drive to push the boundaries of AI/ML applications.
University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (strong experience without a degree is also welcomed).
Deep understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision principles.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, and experience with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
Strong grasp of image processing techniques and data analysis methodologies.
Ability to operate independently and lead others in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Self-organized, proactive, and eager to take initiative and ownership.
Ability to travel



Benefits


Competitive salary with significant development and reward opportunities
Private Medical Insurance
Continuous learning and fast career growth
Traveling opportunities all around the world
A team that promotes innovation and self-initiatives



Our Strength

Our team is the heart of aquaManager. With passion and expertise, we collaborate to empower our clients and drive the evolution of aquaculture technology. Each team member plays a critical role in our success, fostering innovation and sustainable growth for the industry and beyond.

Think You're a Great Fit?

We'd love to hear from you! Apply now to join a team that is making a difference.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: Research Engineer – Machine Learning (Re1)
Description:
Job Reference 88_25_ES_CES_RE1 Position Research engineer


Machine Learning (RE1) Closing Date Wednesday, 07 May, 2025 Reference: 88_25_ES_CES_RE1 Job title: Research engineer
Machine Learning (RE1) About BSC The Barcelona Supercomputing Center
Centro Nacional de Supercomputación (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries. Look At The BSC Experience BSC-CNS YouTube Channel Let's stay connected with BSC Folks! We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research. In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured. We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences. If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer. We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team. Context And Mission We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineer with expertise in machine learning, data science, or computational environmental sciences to contribute to cutting-edge research in Earth Sciences. The selected candidate will play a key role in developing and optimizing machine learning workflows for large-scale land-use, land-cover, and Leaf Area Index (LAI) reconstruction, supporting both historical and future climate scenarios. This position involves integrating deep learning models, refining data workflows, and contributing to predictive modeling efforts within multiple European projects, including TerraDT and CONCERTO. It builds upon methodologies established in the CERISE project and aims to generate high-resolution, temporally extended datasets to improve climate model simulations and advanced Earth system modeling capabilities. This role provides a unique opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of machine learning researchers and climate scientists. The team will focus on developing scalable solutions for processing and analyzing high-dimensional environmental data. The selected candidate will also contribute to scientific publications, project documentation, and technical reporting, collaborating on research efforts within international projects. Key Duties Develop and optimize large-scale machine learning workflows for Earth Science applications, focusing on land-use, land-cover, and LAI downscaling for both historical and future scenarios. Implement and evaluate deep learning architectures for predictive modeling of land-use, land-cover, and climate-related variables, while developing model evaluation methodologies, including visualization and validation tools to compare deep learning models with traditional baselines. Refactor and modularize existing machine learning pipelines to improve scalability, efficiency, and deep learning integration. Work with large geospatial datasets (NetCDF, Zarr) and optimize data processing workflows for high-performance computing (HPC) environments. Ensure that reconstructed land-use, land-cover, and LAI datasets align with Earth system modeling requirements. Participate in scientific publications and technical reporting, contributing to documentation, with opportunities to be involved in academic publications and project reporting. Requirements Education Bachelor or Master's in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Environmental Sciences, or a related field. Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in machine learning libraries such as PyTorch and Scikit-learn. Proven experience in developing and training machine learning models, particularly deep learning architectures. Strong background in handling, analyzing, and validating large-scale geospatial datasets. Experience working in a UNIX-based computational environment. Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience Familiarity with climate, weather, and Earth system datasets (NetCDF, Zarr). Experience in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallelized machine learning workflows. Proficiency in GPU-accelerated machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, RAPIDS, JAX and/ or distributed training using Dask. Understanding of climate and weather models. Competences Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to optimize computational workflows. Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively in a research environment. Excellent communication skills, with a strong ability to document and present research findings. Proficiency in written and spoken English. Conditions The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona Starting date: 01/03/2025 Applications procedure and process All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain: A full CV in English including contact details A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered. Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included. Applications without this document will not be considered. Development of the recruitment process The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposición"). The recruitment process consists of two phases: Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position.
40 points Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources. In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated.
60 points. A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position. The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women. In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process. The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile. At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes. For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact ******. For more information, please follow this link. Deadline The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired. Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted. OTM-R principles for selection processes BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc. BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.
